Main Page | Modules | Class Hierarchy | Alphabetical List | Data Structures | File List | Data Fields | Examples

map_defarea.tcl

This example show how to set domain of definition for surface. In this example we use example function from binary ROFF file "func.func". We use command func_to_defarea to make domain of the function. After that we load function from file "func.func" again and recalculate it with respect of constructed domain of definition. Result on the picture below:

Script to obtain the result (file surfit/examples/test/map_defarea.tcl)

#
load libsurfit[info sharedlibextension]

# resulting surface must have name "map_defarea"
set map_name map_defarea

# loading func from binary ROFF file
func_load func.func

# convering func to defarea
func_to_defarea 0 60

# loading func from binary ROFF file
func_load func.func

# constructing surfit_grid
grid_get -10 10 0.2 -10 10 0.4

# running CMOFS algorithm
solve

# unloading surfit_grid from memory
grid_unload

# saving results to binary ROFF file
file_save map_defarea.dat


surfit-1.0.0pre
